citation.article-title: Desulfovirga adipica gen. nov., sp. nov., an adipate-degrading, gram-negative, sulfate-reducing bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Desulfovirga adipica sp. nov.
Desulfovirga adipica (a.di'pi.ca. M.L. n. acidum adipinum adipic acid (adipate); M.L. fem. adj. adipica pertaining to adipic acid and the organism's ability to degrade it)
Cells are 0.8-2.0x2.2-4.0 μm with round ends, singly or in pairs.

In the presence of excess sulfate, adipate, (E)-2-hexenedioate, (E)-3-hexenedioate, pyruvate and lactate, C1-C9 straight-chain fatty acids, C4-C6 iso-fatty acids and C2-C9 straight-chain primary alcohols are completely oxidized and 3-phenylpropionate is stoichiometrically oxidized to benzoate.
Straight-chain saturated C3-C81,ω-dicarboxylates are not utilized except adipate.
G+C content of DNA is 60 mol%.
Habitat: anaerobic digestor of the municipal wastewater treatment centre, Tsuchiura, Ibaraki, Japan.
